# The `Scheduler` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Class <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/scheduler">Scheduler</a> is responsible for issuing instructions to pipeline resources. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Class <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/scheduler">Scheduler</a> is responsible for issuing instructions to pipeline resources.

Internally, it delegates to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resourcemanager">ResourceManager</a> the management of processor resources. This class is also responsible for tracking the progress of instructions from the dispatch stage, until the write-back stage.

Definition at line 70 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h">Scheduler.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### analyzeDataDependencies() {#a9651d447561aa0aea1b3171eee94152c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::mca::Scheduler::analyzeDataDependencies (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &gt; &amp; RegDeps, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &gt; &amp; MemDeps)</>}>
This method is called by the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/executestage">ExecuteStage</a> at the end of each cycle to identify bottlenecks caused by data dependencies.

Vector RegDeps is populated by instructions that were not issued because of unsolved register dependencies. Vector MemDeps is populated by instructions that were not issued because of unsolved memory dependencies.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h/#l00251">251</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h">Scheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mca/lib/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-cpp/#l00249">249</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mca/lib/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-cpp">Scheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### cycleEvent() {#ab88715985e19d51a306fb8be0cf857f3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::mca::Scheduler::cycleEvent (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mca/#a961b7aeaca000c803c0f4b1df4d26c27">ResourceRef</a> &gt; &amp; Freed, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &gt; &amp; Executed, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &gt; &amp; Pending, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &gt; &amp; Ready)</>}>
This routine notifies the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/scheduler">Scheduler</a> that a new cycle just started.

It notifies the underlying <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/resourcemanager">ResourceManager</a> that a new cycle just started. Vector <code>Freed</code> is populated with resourceRef related to resources that have changed in state, and that are now available to new instructions. Instructions executed are added to vector Executed, while vector Ready is populated with instructions that have become ready in this new cycle. Vector Pending is popluated by instructions that have transitioned through the pending stat during this cycle. The Pending and Ready sets may not be disjoint. An instruction is allowed to transition from the WAIT state to the READY state (going through the PENDING state) within a single cycle. That means, instructions may appear in both the Pending and Ready set.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h/#l00225">225</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h">Scheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mca/lib/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-cpp/#l00265">265</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mca/lib/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-cpp">Scheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### dispatch() {#ab72375182cfa0b8e37b997b861e35208}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::mca::Scheduler::dispatch (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp; IR)</>}>
Reserves buffer and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/lsunit">LSUnit</a> queue resources that are necessary to issue this instruction.

Returns true if instruction IR is ready to be issued to the underlying pipelines. Note that this operation cannot fail; it assumes that a previous call to method <code>isAvailable(IR)</code> returned <code>SC&#95;AVAILABLE</code>.

If IR is a memory operation, then the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/scheduler">Scheduler</a> queries the LS unit to obtain a LS token. An LS token is used internally to track memory dependencies.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h/#l00198">198</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/mca/include/llvm/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-h">Scheduler.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mca/lib/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-cpp/#l00301">301</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mca/lib/mca/hardwareunits/scheduler-cpp">Scheduler.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getResourceID() {#a06f0458c240c7f93993b487406362dd4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::mca::Scheduler::getResourceID (uint64&#95;t Mask) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Convert a resource mask into a valid llvm processor resource identifier.

Only the most significant bit of the Mask is used by this method to identify the processor resource.

### hadTokenStall() {#af9e624cddbeb545e5eded5202948ec34}

<MemberDefinition

### isAvailable() {#a5edfbe268d597c17c00c74ccc1cf59c4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Scheduler::Status llvm::mca::Scheduler::isAvailable (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp; IR)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if the instruction in &#39;IR&#39; can be dispatched during this cycle.

Return SC&#95;AVAILABLE if both scheduler and LS resources are available.

This method is also responsible for setting field HadTokenStall if IR cannot be dispatched to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/scheduler">Scheduler</a> due to unavailable resources.

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="InstRef llvm::mca::Scheduler::select ()">
Select the next instruction to issue from the ReadySet.

Returns an invalid instruction reference if there are no ready instructions, or if processor resources are not available.
